nodes.description: Establishes a connection to a mail server using basic authentication or OAuth2. Creates a client session for accessing mail operations like reading, sending, and managing emails.
nodes.name: Connect

outClientId.title: Client Id
outClientId.description: Unique identifier for the mail server connection. Used to reference this specific connection in other mail operations.

optAuthenticationType.title: Authentication Type
optAuthenticationType.description: Method of authentication: Basic (username/password) or OAuth2 (token-based). OAuth2 is required for modern providers like Gmail and Outlook.

optEmailCredentials.title: Mail Server Credentials
optEmailCredentials.description: Email credentials from vault containing server settings (host, port, username, password) for IMAP and SMTP connections. Required for basic authentication.
optEmailCredentials.subtitle: Credentials

optTokenCredentials.title: OAuth2 Token Credentials
optTokenCredentials.description: Required only if OAuth2 Authentication Type is selected. Needs a Document Category Type credential created inside a vault that contains {'client_id':'<your_client_id>', 'client_secret':'<your_client_secret>'}. OAuth2 Client ID and Client Secret values should be obtained from your mail provider.
optTokenCredentials.subtitle: Credentials

nodes.name: Disconnect
nodes.description: Closes an active mail server connection and cleans up associated resources. Should be called when mail operations are complete.

inClientId.title: Client Id
inClientId.description: The client connection identifier to disconnect. Must match a client ID from a previous Connect node operation.

nodes.name: Send Mail
nodes.description: Sends email messages with support for attachments, HTML/plain text body, multiple recipients (To, CC, BCC), and Reply All functionality. Works with basic authentication or OAuth2 connections. Reply All mode automatically populates recipients from original emails.

inClientId.title: Client Id
inClientId.description: Connection identifier for OAuth2 authentication. If using basic authentication, this is not required as credentials are provided in Options.

inFrom.title: From
inFrom.description: Sender's email address. Must be a valid email format (e.g., 'sender@example.com'). Required field.

inTo.title: To
inTo.description: Primary recipient email addresses. Multiple addresses can be separated by commas (e.g., 'user1@example.com,user2@example.com').

inCc.title: Cc
inCc.description: Carbon copy recipients who will receive a copy of the email. Multiple addresses can be separated by commas. Optional field.

inBcc.title: Bcc
inBcc.description: Blind carbon copy recipients who will receive the email without other recipients knowing. Multiple addresses separated by commas. Optional field.

inReplyTo.title: Reply To
inReplyTo.description: Email address where replies should be sent. If specified, recipients can reply to this address instead of the From address.

inSubject.title: Subject
inSubject.description: Email subject line. This will appear in the recipient's inbox as the email title.

inBody.title: Body
inBody.description: Main content of the email. Can be plain text or HTML depending on the 'HTML Body' option setting.

inReplyToMailID.title: Reply To Mail ID
inReplyToMailID.description: Mailbox and UID of the original email to reply to (format: INBOX/12345). This field is required when Reply All Mode is enabled. Use the 'MailboxUID' field from GetMail or SearchMail output.

optHtmlBody.title: HTML Body
optHtmlBody.description: If true, treats the body content as HTML and renders it in the email client. If false, sends as plain text.

optMessageMode.title: Message Mode
optMessageMode.description: Select the type of email to send: New Email (default), Reply (to sender only), Reply All (to sender and all recipients), or Forward (to new recipients). Reply/Reply All/Forward require Reply To Mail ID to be provided.

optIncludeOriginalMessage.title: Include Original Message
optIncludeOriginalMessage.description: When enabled with Reply/Reply All/Forward modes, includes the original email content with proper quote formatting in the body. The formatting style is controlled by Quote Style option.

optQuoteStyle.title: Quote Style
optQuoteStyle.description: Choose the formatting style for quoted original message: Gmail (modern blockquote), Outlook (traditional headers with separator), or Simple (basic > prefix). Only applies when Include Original Message is enabled.

optIncludeOriginalAttachments.title: Include Original Attachments
optIncludeOriginalAttachments.description: When enabled with Reply/Reply All/Forward modes, includes all attachments (including embedded images with preserved Content-IDs) from the original email. Typically used with Forward mode to match Gmail/Outlook behavior.

optUseAttachmentIndexAsCID.title: Attachment Index As CID
optUseAttachmentIndexAsCID.description: Use this option to embed images in an email with in your HTML body. HTML Body option has to be selected, too. The '0' here represents the index of the attachments array, which will be used as the Content-ID for the attachment.

optAttachments.title: Attachments
optAttachments.description: Array of file paths to attach to the email. Files will be attached as email attachments that recipients can download.

optCustomAttachments.title: Custom Attachments
optCustomAttachments.description: Static list of file paths to attach to the email. Each entry should be a valid file path. Files will be attached as email attachments.

nodes.name: Delete Mail
nodes.description: Deletes specific email messages by UID or deletes all messages from a mail folder. Messages are marked for deletion and permanently removed from the server.

inClientId.title: Client Id
inClientId.description: Connection identifier from a Connect node. Required for mail server authentication and access.

inMailFolder.title: Mail Folder
inMailFolder.description: Name of the mail folder containing the messages to delete (e.g., 'INBOX', 'Sent', 'Drafts'). Folder must exist on the server.

inUid.title: Messages Id
inUid.description: Unique identifier (UID) of the specific message to delete. If 'Delete All' option is enabled, this parameter is ignored and all messages in the folder are deleted.

optDeleteAll.title: Delete All
optDeleteAll.description: If true, deletes all messages in the specified folder. If false, deletes only the message with the specified Messages Id (UID).

nodes.name: Get Mail
nodes.description: Retrieves email messages from a specified mail folder. Can fetch a limited number of messages, filter for unread messages, and optionally mark messages as read.

nodes.name: Search Mail
nodes.description: Searches for email messages based on various criteria including sender, recipient, subject, body content, date range, and message ID. Returns matching messages or just their IDs.

nodes.name: Save Attachments
nodes.description: Downloads and saves email attachments from a specific message to a local directory. Returns the full paths of downloaded files.

nodes.name: Move Mail
nodes.description: Moves a specific email message from one mail folder to another using the message's unique identifier (UID).

nodes.name: Create Folder
nodes.description: Creates a new mail folder on the server with the specified name. The folder can then be used to organize and store email messages.

nodes.name: Delete Folder
nodes.description: Permanently deletes a mail folder from the server. The folder must be empty or the operation may fail depending on server configuration.

nodes.name: List Folders
nodes.description: Retrieves a list of all available mail folders from the server. Returns an array of folder names that can be used in other mail operations.
